ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Estimate the p-values for predictors x against target variable y in lasso regression, using the regularization strength when each predictor enters the active set of regularization path for the first time as the statistic. This is based on the assumption that predictors (of the same variance) that (first) become active earlier tend to be more significant. Three null distributions are supported: normal and spherical, which are computed separately for each predictor and analytically under approximation, which aims at efficiency and accuracy for small p-values.

Estimate the p-values for predictors x against target variable y in lasso regression, using the regularization strength when each predictor enters the active set of regularization path for the first time as the statistic. This is based on the assumption that predictors (of the same variance) that (first) become active earlier tend to be more significant. Three null distributions are supported: normal and spherical, which are computed separately for each predictor and analytically under approximation, which aims at efficiency and accuracy for small p-values.

name: r-lassopv
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.2.0' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-lassopv
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/lassopv_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/lassopv/lassopv_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 3f65b1fe1b0d4e700c0a7129db12333bd2cad2523df998c7bc5e0e03b8b45c79

build:
  number: 1006
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-lars
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-lars

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('lassopv')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('lassopv')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/lingfeiwang/lassopv
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: 'Estimate the p-values for predictors x against target variable y in lasso regression,
    using the regularization strength when each predictor enters the active set of regularization
    path for the first time as the statistic. This is based on the assumption that predictors
    (of the same variance) that (first) become active earlier tend to be more significant.
    Three null distributions are supported: normal and spherical, which are computed
    separately for each predictor and analytically under approximation, which aims at
    efficiency and accuracy for small p-values.'
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
